DM [BN] BOT 19-08-2023 05:19
Continuation from https://discord.com/channels/905604470644285460/1050639611484983306/1142122200019779617. *As Belnir resumes his vigil beside Fritz, he witnesses the ongoing interplay between Fritz and the haunting echoes of von Weerg's consciousness. However, as the moments unfold and the exchanges continue, it becomes apparent to Belnir that this isn't a simple attempt at possession or control, as one sees with ghosts and organic mortals. Instead, there's an undercurrent of something deeper, more nuanced. Belnir's intuition begins to piece together a different puzzle. This isn't a story of domination; it's a story of fusion. Von Weerg's desires aren't centered on overtaking Fritz's consciousness but intertwining with it, merging their identities into a single entity. While the motive isn't apparent -- perhaps it's simple immortality, but perhaps it's something different, something mor eintimate -- it is apparent that if Fritz's undertakes this journey to the Soul Forge, it isn't just a quest to unravel the mysteries of their creation; it's part of von Weerg's aspiration for unity. But it also becomes apparent to both, these hallucinations will continue to worsen if not treated, somehow. Do Fritz and Belnir have time to research a solution properly, before madness sets in? Could.. Could this Soul Forge also be used to reverse the process, remove any lingering presense of von Weerg?*
Belnir BOT 20-08-2023 06:43
That was it. A clock is ticking and any delay of action comes at ever increasing risks. Belnir looks at a clock on the wall and mentally notes the time. Stands up and turns to Fritz with a decisive look in his eye. "Your mind will be your own." He pulls from his deepest well of arcane power and gives Fritz a light touch, delivering the Mind Blank spell. "I hadn't the time to explain it before we ran off to aid the fight in Vallaki. This is the single greatest protection I can grant, it is the most formidable spell to protect your mind from outside prying, damage, and influence. It is only second in this regards to a true Wish- like the world reshaping magic associated with genies. I will do my utmost to assure that you remain under this ward." Belnir explains his sudden switch from methodical studying and questions to action and declaration "I've had a great insight and now I'm sure where we must go and go with haste. There will be great dangers and much still to solve that is on the edge of arcane knowledge, we'll need more great minds from differing specialties. I'll reach out to Korvin, his divinatory magic may be our saving grace, and I will seek out a wizard I met in passing who has unique insight into arcane abilities very few can even learn, let alone fully grasp."

DM [BN] BOT 22-08-2023 17:50
The newly formed party sets forth on the journey, following Belnir's meticulously crafted maps to guide their way to the mysterious destination known as the Amber Temple. The journey is easy, at least to start. It's a relatively nice day for Barovia. The locals refer to it as Spring despite being well after the midsummer. The path branches off from the road to Krezk and the winery, beginning the slow climb up the mountain, still shrouded in the clouds that are present despite the relative warmth. The ascent is steady. The elevation quickly climbs. Before too long, you pass most of the shepherds watching their flocks, none too far from civilization and the safety of town walls.

As you talk, the journey takes you higher into the mounts. The air grows cold, and your shadows all become longer as they day winds on towards sunset. A vision? An illusion? The glow seems to be coming from several ridges away. However, for Fritz, this scene is more than an optical illusion. It's a symphony cacophony of sensations. They feel the burning heat of a nearby fire, and the distinct sound of metal hitting metal, not of combat, but of a hammer and anvil. Out of the corner of their eye, they catch a glimpse of a rune etched into metal, glowing with pure fire. Shadowy figures in the other corner of their eye, huge, taller than even Fritz at their largest. (edited)

DM [BN] BOT 28-08-2023 02:55
*You advance along the winding path, your familiars' warnings preparing for the sight that greets you as you round the next bend. The path opens into a valley of undeniable grandeur, the tall cliffs rising on each side, sheltering from the strong, cold winds above. Across the valley, over a bridge spanning a river originating at a waterfall on the north cliff, are the forges you surmised. The forges are a marvel to behold. Stone structures, simple but functional, hewn from the stones of the cliffs themselves. But that's not what makes them unique - it's what lies at the heart of each: A fiery creature, large, scaled, with a long tail like a lizard but arms like any of you, made of pure elemental fire. Those of you knowledgeable in the arcane arts Arcana Proficiency recognize them to be Salamanders, usually bound in servitude to the harsh Efreet, were now here, working freely. These elemental fire lizards lend their very essence to the forge. And next to each forge sands a figure, a broad shouldered man, but who's hair and beards are made of elemental fire. Arcana Proficiency Azers, master craftsman also of the Elemental Plane of Fire, enemies of the Efreet. The men of fire and the fire lizards work side by side, working molten metal with their bare hands. The are crafting weapons of war - swords, axes, spears, and hammers - with shafts formed by the molten metal, but each weapon's head is made of pure flames, glowing fiercely, never cooling as the rest of the weapons cool.*

*But while the forges are spectacular, they are not what actually drew your eye first. In the heart of the fiery forge valley, two impossibly imposing figures stand as sentinels of fire. Cloaked in the heat's embrace, a colossal fire giant commands attention. It stands near the forges, overseeing the work. The giant is clad in incandescent plate armor, barely containing the intense heat within. But on the bridge spanning the river is another enormous creature - a fiend, or demon - a horned visage, cloven hooves, and a forked tail. This is the smell of brimstone, of fire of the Nine Hells rather than more pure fire of the elemental plane. The flames reflect the demon's ambitions, and the power drawn sraight from the Hells itself.* The demon speaks to the giant, it's voice snarling, deep, thunderous. Belnir's Magnificent Mansion
The portal reveals an unassuming square room constructed of smooth dark grey stone. Once inside, to the right, one can see the the singular door of the room. The walls opposite of the portal and the door sport a low shelf, that doubles as a bench, and numerous hooks to hang coats and the like. Through the door is a white marble banquet hall with a high ceiling and enough room to feed a small army. The room's wall, its dozen or so doors, and the long tables are grand Dwarven stonework but the small gardens and reading nooks that dot the periphery and the wooden furnishings follow Sylvan design. Sourceless light keeps the space well lit, an illusory touch make it look as if it was sunlight. Upon first entry from the foyer, trays gently float out from a kitchen doorway and approach Belnir and his guests. Each bearing a small assortment of drinks, including hot teas and chilled alcoholic beverages. Most of the doors lead to comfortable bedrooms, each equipped with writing desks and a small variety of chairs. A few doors have been engraved with the function they have been furnished for: Library, Workshop, Laboratory, or Infirmary.
